title: Marcital
author: Marcital
content: I'm offering 100% real reviews for your business by real users. we will give you 5 stars and positive feedbacks to help people trust your business and believe in it.Or the other way around we can spam a business to destroy it's rating on all 3 platforms_________________________________________Prices (Positive) :4$ per ReviewMin Order 25 Reviews + 5 Stars_____Mid Order 50 Reviews + 5 Stars_____Max Order 100 Reviews + 5 StarsStars only without reviews (100) 5 Stars = 200$_________________________________________Prices (Negative) :8$ per ReviewMin Order 25 Reviews + 1 Stars_____Mid Order 50 Reviews + 1 Stars_____Max Order 100 Reviews + 1 StarsStars attack only without reviews (100) 1 Star = 300$Negative ratings attack is more expensive because we are taking the risk for you and the responsibility_________________________________________Only Crypto accepted for payment (BTC - XMR - DOGE -USDT)If you are interested just DM me

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: You are lying here. You wrote 100% real reviews, but you are doing the opposite. Your all reviews are just fake and manipulated. Have you ever thought others would be lost due to your fake reviews? Does Google allow you to fake reviews? It's against Google's standards. For example, you gave positive reviews for a phishing site and someone impressed based on your reviews. Eventually, that person will lose funds. Who will be responsible for that?

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 07:35:52 PMHow have you decided that it's fake have you bought my service before ? A fake review in this context means that you are writing a review based on a non-existent experience with the company. Regardless of how "the market works" in your opinion, your service is in obvious conflict with the terms of use and good practice of the mentioned platforms.

comments.author: Hodoor
comments.body: Quote from: The Cryptovator on September 11, 2022, 07:05:54 PMYou are lying here. You wrote 100% real reviews, but you are doing the opposite. Your all reviews are just fake and manipulated. Have you ever thought others would be lost due to your fake reviews? Does Google allow you to fake reviews? It's against Google's standards. For example, you gave positive reviews for a phishing site and someone impressed based on your reviews. Eventually, that person will lose funds. Who will be responsible for that? I think what he means by real reviews is that they come from real users and not bots. The reviews are obviously bought so they can't be legit or honest. Dunno tho i could be wrong.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 04:59:30 PMNegative ratings attack is more expensive because we are taking the risk for you and the responsibilityCare to explain how on earth you're taking the risk on behalf of someone else in such cases?Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 07:35:52 PMmoney run everything in the marketAnd you think it's perfectly fine to sell your soul [SMH]?Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 10:08:35 PMMy service is not going against the terms of use it's completely normalIt's not normal [stop being delusional]!Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 10:15:43 PMIt's a normal review service to help businesses grow upThe only type of businesses that your so-called service helps are the ones that are actually fake/scams and don't exist in the real world!Quote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 10:15:43 PMit's a legit strategy by it selfNothing about that strategy is legit [wake up]

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on September 16, 2022, 11:07:58 AMQuote from: Marcital on September 11, 2022, 10:15:43 PMit's a legit strategy by it selfNothing about that strategy is legit [wake up] I don't know what's worst here, positive or negative fake reviews. For a few bucks, he will ruin someone's reputation. For what? someone wants to weaken the competition or just doesn't like someone's business. I would like to know OP's page on Google, and Trustpilot to give him a couple of free negative reviews. but not fake.
